titleStmt.title: Romes eccho, or, A dialogve betvvixt a papist and a Protestant vvith an admonition to ovr lordly bishops and a briefe relation of the suffering of that worthy and religious devine master Bates, and the inhumane usage of his dead bones afterward, who died in the gatehouse under the bishops tyrannie.
titleStmt.author: Cleveland, John, 1613-1658.

titleStmt.title: Romes eccho, or, A dialogve betvvixt a papist and a Protestant vvith an admonition to ovr lordly bishops and a briefe relation of the suffering of that worthy and religious devine master Bates, and the inhumane usage of his dead bones afterward, who died in the gatehouse under the bishops tyrannie.
titleStmt.author: Cleveland, John, 1613-1658.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Cleveland in the Wrenn catalogue.
Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
